text: what comes next for Egypt that early
optimism of the Arab Spring has given
way to discontent there almost
three-quarters of Egyptians aren't
satisfied with their country's direction
that's according to a new poll conducted
by the Pew Research Center so let's see
where that pessimism falls historically
this graph shows the percentage of
Egyptians saying they don't like the way
things are going in the country right
here marks the revolution of 2011 you
can see how today's discontent is
actually higher than before the
revolution even just the past year has
seen a reversal of opinions in 2013 pew
research found that when it came to
democracy versus stability most
Egyptians saw democracy as the priority
but now those numbers have nearly
flipped so yes a majority value
stability than most but what path are
Egyptians hoping to take Pew Research
ask people to rate the importance of
various issues going forward a better
economy fair courts and law and order
were at the top of the list and since
Egyptians are choosing their next
president what about elections well it
turns out that less than half of people
consider honest elections as very
important for their country's future
David Botti BBC News Washington
